title: Mar-Martine I know not why a trueth in rime set out maie not as wel mar Martine and his mates, as shamelesse lies in prose-books cast about marpriests, & prelates, and subvert whole states. For where truth builds, and lying overthroes, one truth in rime, is worth ten lies in prose.
author: Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601, attributed name.
notes: A tract in the Martin Marprelate controversy.
Sometimes attributed to Thomas Nash and John Lyly.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
